title: Unique, and rare, but very uncomfortable, but yet, unreportable
body:
This was my first and only time encountering this odd player type. Most people who I report are inters, toxic people, or just straight  up refusing to work as a team. But this person, was very different. they started off around 30 seconds depicting s_xual acts in very great detail. Everyone in the game was pissed at them. They straight up continued doing that the whole game. They fed hard since they were typing it all in all chat. Everyone basicly agreed to report them, but post game, when you reported them, there was no option for it. They were trying, werent being toxic, they were using and slurs, yet it was obviously wrong. In no universe is it acceptable to do that. The report page should have a Miscellaneous section that REQUIRES an explanation at the bottom.

Best of luck

TheAppleTree25 (NA)

replies.body:
>"They straight up continued doing that the whole game. They fed hard since they were typing it all in all chat."

Typing so much in chat that it inhibits your gameplay is considered griefing, just report under that category if something similar happens in the future.
I'd also consider it "verbal abuse" which is another category.

That's verbal abuse.

**"Verbal Abuse**
Including, but not limited to language that is unlawful, harmful, threatening, abusive, harassing, defamatory, vulgar, obscene, **sexually explicit**, or otherwise objectionable"

Wait theres no "other" section in the report area? I could've sworn there was but I never actually used it so it could just be in my head.

You could always send in a ticket to riot with the game information. They have access to the chat logs so I don't think screenshots are needed.

>
> This is considered offensive, sensless accusing, and thoughtless assuming. I will let this slide, but i expect you to be more careful when posting content. thankyou

Whoa, don't condescend too hard; you'll sprain something!

I think you straight up misunderstood what he was saying. It's obvious that OP wasn't accusing everyone of inting, they were using that as a segway to lead into their next point.

 Please don't try to moderate others, this is a public forum. If you're going to try to tell someone what to do anyway, _suggest_ what they can do in a polite way instead of talking down to them.
Way to take a quote out of context
just mute him and move on
You liked seeing all the descriptions? Why didn't you mute after 1-2 sentences?
